definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: They prefer to buy Japanese silk and rayon.
sentences.chinese: 他们用日本生丝和人造丝。

sentences.english: Artificial silk creases more easily than natural silk.
sentences.chinese: 人造丝比天然丝更容易起皱。

sentences.english: A sturdy, tightly woven fabric of cotton, wool, or rayon twill.
sentences.chinese: 华达呢结实紧密的棉毛织品或人造丝斜纹布。

sentences.english: Do not use anything containing rayon or polyester.
sentences.chinese: 不使用任何含有人造丝或聚酯。

sentences.english: Cotton and rayon yarns are most often sized with water-insoluble starches.
sentences.chinese: 棉和人造丝纱多用不溶于水的淀粉上浆。

sentences.english: Silk is distinct from rayon in every respect.
sentences.chinese: 在各个方面真丝跟人造丝截然不同。

sentences.english: The viscose in acid bath coagulate to viscose rayon.
sentences.chinese: 粘胶在酸浴中成形为粘胶人造丝。

sentences.english: Silk and rayon are two distinct things.
sentences.chinese: 蚕丝和人造丝是两种不同的东西。

sentences.english: Cotton is a natural fiber, but rayon and nylon are synthetic.
sentences.chinese: 棉花是一种自然光纤，但人造丝和尼龙是合成产品。

sentences.english: Copper is also employed in the alkaline Bemberg rayon process.
sentences.chinese: 铜也用在碱性本姆伯人造丝生产中。

definition: variant of 滌綸|涤纶[di2 lun2]
